intro: Quercus prinoides, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its white to pale gray bark and lobed leaves. The tree produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It typically grows in dry to moist forests and thrives in well-drained soils. Quercus prinoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
